body:
Reviewer's guide (collapsed on small PRs) ## Reviewer's Guide Ensures ReadabilityClient caches parsed article content off the main thread using an RxJava Observable on an IO scheduler, and removes a temporary crash handler used for debugging. #### Sequence diagram for async readability caching using IO scheduler ```mermaid sequenceDiagram title Async_caching_flow_in_ReadabilityClient actor User participant WebView participant ReadabilityClient participant ReadabilityCache participant IoScheduler User->>WebView: openArticle(url) WebView->>ReadabilityClient: onPageFinished(view, url) ReadabilityClient->>ReadabilityClient: parseReadabilityJson(value) alt parse_success ReadabilityClient->>ReadabilityClient: createObservableFromCallable ReadabilityClient->>IoScheduler: subscribeOn(mIoScheduler) ReadabilityClient->>ReadabilityCache: putReadability(itemId, savedContent) async ReadabilityCache->>ReadabilityCache: writeToDatabase ReadabilityCache-->>ReadabilityClient: onNext(true) ReadabilityClient-->>ReadabilityClient: successHandler else parse_failure ReadabilityClient->>ReadabilityClient: logParseWarning end opt cache_error ReadabilityCache-->>ReadabilityClient: onError(error) ReadabilityClient->>ReadabilityClient: Log.e Failed_to_cache_content end ``` #### Class diagram for updated ReadabilityClient threading and caching ```mermaid classDiagram title Updated_ReadabilityClient_class_structure class ReadabilityClient { - ReadabilityCache mCache - Scheduler mIoScheduler + onPageFinished(view: WebView, url: String): void } class ReadabilityCache { + putReadability(itemId: String, content: String): void } class Scheduler { + scheduleIo(task: Runnable): void } ReadabilityClient --> ReadabilityCache : uses ReadabilityClient --> Scheduler : uses_for_background_io ``` ### File-Level Changes | Change | Details | Files | | ------ | ------- | ----- | | Move readability caching database write off the main thread using RxJava. |
  • Wrap the mCache.putReadability call in Observable.fromCallable to defer execution
  • Capture parsed content into a final local variable to use inside the lambda
  • Schedule the Observable on mIoScheduler via subscribeOn to run work on an IO thread
  • Subscribe with no-op success consumer and an error consumer that logs failures to cache content
| `app/src/main/java/io/github/hidroh/materialistic/data/ReadabilityClient.java` | | Remove temporary use of CustomCrashHandler used only for debugging this issue. |
  • Delete references/usages of CustomCrashHandler related to ReadabilityClient database crash investigation
| `app/src/main/java/io/github/hidroh/materialistic/data/ReadabilityClient.java` |
---
Tips and commands #### Interacting with Sourcery - **Trigger a new review:** Comment `@sourcery-ai review` on the pull request. - **Continue discussions:** Reply directly to Sourcery's review comments. - **Generate a GitHub issue from a review comment:** Ask Sourcery to create an issue from a review comment by replying to it. You can also reply to a review comment with `@sourcery-ai issue` to create an issue from it. - **Generate a pull request title:** Write `@sourcery-ai` anywhere in the pull request title to generate a title at any time. You can also comment `@sourcery-ai title` on the pull request to (re-)generate the title at any time. - **Generate a pull request summary:** Write `@sourcery-ai summary` anywhere in the pull request body to generate a PR summary at any time exactly where you want it. You can also comment `@sourcery-ai summary` on the pull request to (re-)generate the summary at any time. - **Generate reviewer's guide:** Comment `@sourcery-ai guide` on the pull request to (re-)generate the reviewer's guide at any time. - **Resolve all Sourcery comments:** Comment `@sourcery-ai resolve` on the pull request to resolve all Sourcery comments. Useful if you've already addressed all the comments and don't want to see them anymore. - **Dismiss all Sourcery reviews:** Comment `@sourcery-ai dismiss` on the pull request to dismiss all existing Sourcery reviews. Especially useful if you want to start fresh with a new review - don't forget to comment `@sourcery-ai review` to trigger a new review! #### Customizing Your Experience Access your [dashboard](https://app.sourcery.ai) to: - Enable or disable review features such as the Sourcery-generated pull request summary, the reviewer's guide, and others. - Change the review language. - Add, remove or edit custom review instructions. - Adjust other review settings. #### Getting Help - [Contact our support team](mailto:support@sourcery.ai) for questions or feedback. - Visit our [documentation](https://docs.sourcery.ai) for detailed guides and information. - Keep in touch with the Sourcery team by following us on [X/Twitter](https://x.com/SourceryAI), [LinkedIn](https://www.linkedin.com/company/sourcery-ai/) or [GitHub](https://github.com/sourcery-ai).

body:
## Summary of Changes Hello @sheepdestroyer, I'm Gemini Code Assist[^1]! I'm currently reviewing this pull request and will post my feedback shortly. In the meantime, here's a summary to help you and other reviewers quickly get up to speed! This pull request resolves a critical issue where the application would crash due to database write operations being performed synchronously on the main thread within the `ReadabilityClient`. By refactoring the database interaction to an asynchronous, background process using RxJava, the change ensures application stability and responsiveness, particularly when parsing and caching article content. ### Highlights * **Crash Fix**: Addresses a crash occurring when `ReadabilityClient` attempts to perform database write operations on the main thread. * **Asynchronous Database Write**: The `mCache.putReadability` call has been wrapped in an RxJava `Observable` and scheduled to execute on an I/O thread (`mIoScheduler`), preventing main thread blocking. * **Debugging Code Removal**: The temporary `CustomCrashHandler` that was added for debugging purposes has been removed.
Using Gemini Code Assist
The full guide for Gemini Code Assist can be found on our [documentation page](https://developers.google.com/gemini-code-assist/docs/review-github-code), here are some quick tips. Invoking Gemini You can request assistance from Gemini at any point by creating a comment using either `/gemini ` or `@gemini-code-assist `. Below is a summary of the supported commands on the current page. Feature | Command | Description --- | --- | --- Code Review | `/gemini review` | Performs a code review for the current pull request in its current state. Pull Request Summary | `/gemini summary` | Provides a summary of the current pull request in its current state. Comment | @gemini-code-assist | Responds in comments when explicitly tagged, both in pull request comments and review comments. Help | `/gemini help` | Displays a list of available commands. Customization To customize Gemini Code Assist for GitHub experience, repository maintainers can create a configuration file and/or provide a custom code review style guide (such as PEP-8 for Python) by creating and adding files to a `.gemini/` folder in the base of the repository. Detailed instructions can be found [here](https://developers.google.com/gemini-code-assist/docs/customize-gemini-behavior-github). Limitations & Feedback Gemini Code Assist may make mistakes. Please leave feedback on any instances where its feedback is incorrect or counter productive. You can react with :thumbsup: and :thumbsdown: on @gemini-code-assist comments. If you're interested in giving your feedback about your experience with Gemini Code Assist for Github and other Google products, sign up [here](https://google.qualtrics.com/jfe/form/SV_2cyuGuTWsEw84yG). You can also get AI-powered code generation, chat, as well as code reviews directly in the IDE at no cost with the [Gemini Code Assist IDE Extension](https://cloud.google.com/products/gemini/code-assist).
[^1]: Review the [Privacy Notices](https://policies.google.com/privacy), [Generative AI Prohibited Use Policy](https://policies.google.com/terms/generative-ai/use-policy), [Terms of Service](https://policies.google.com/terms), and learn how to configure Gemini Code Assist in GitHub [here](https://developers.google.com/gemini-code-assist/docs/customize-gemini-behavior-github). Gemini can make mistakes, so double check it and [use code with caution](https://support.google.com/legal/answer/13505487).

body:
> [!NOTE] > ## Other AI code review bot(s) detected > > CodeRabbit has detected other AI code review bot(s) in this pull request and will avoid duplicating their findings in the review comments. This may lead to a less comprehensive review.
üìù Walkthrough ## Walkthrough Convert synchronous readability caching to an asynchronous background action: cache writes are scheduled as a Completable on the IO scheduler, tracked by a CompositeDisposable, with error logging and a new public close() to clear disposables; observable emission remains unchanged. ## Changes | Cohort / File(s) | Change Summary | |---|---| | **Readability caching async update**
`app/src/main/java/io/github/hidroh/materialistic/data/ReadabilityClient.java` | Replaced direct `mCache.putReadability(itemId, content)` with `Completable.fromAction(...)` scheduled on `Schedulers.io()`; added `private final CompositeDisposable mDisposables = new CompositeDisposable();`, added `public void close()` to clear disposables, added imports for `Completable` and `CompositeDisposable`, and added error logging for caching failures. | ## Sequence Diagram(s) ```mermaid sequenceDiagram participant Client participant ReadabilityClient participant CompletableTask as "Completable (IO)" participant Cache participant Logger Client->>ReadabilityClient: request readability(itemId) ReadabilityClient->>Client: emit content (synchronously) ReadabilityClient->>CompletableTask: schedule cache write (mDisposables.add) CompletableTask->>Cache: mCache.putReadability(itemId, savedContent) alt cache write fails Cache-->>Logger: emit error end Note right of ReadabilityClient: close() clears mDisposables ``` ## Estimated code review effort üéØ 3 (Moderate) | ‚è±Ô∏è ~20 minutes ## Poem > üêá I moved the write to a softer night, > > Completable hums while IO takes flight, > > Disposables hold the busy trail, > > Close the box and silence the tale.
üö• Pre-merge checks | ‚úÖ 2 | ‚ùå 1
‚ùå Failed checks (1 warning) | Check name | Status | Explanation | Resolution | | :----------------: | :--------- | :----------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | :--------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | | Docstring Coverage | ‚ö†Ô∏è Warning | Docstring coverage is 0.00% which is insufficient. The required threshold is 80.00%. | Write docstrings for the functions missing them to satisfy the coverage threshold. |
‚úÖ Passed checks (2 passed) | Check name | Status | Explanation | | :---------------: | :------- | :----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | | Title check | ‚úÖ Passed | The title accurately describes the main fix: converting synchronous main-thread database caching to asynchronous IO-scheduled operations to prevent crashes. | | Description Check | ‚úÖ Passed | Check skipped - CodeRabbit‚Äôs high-level summary is enabled. |
‚úèÔ∏è Tip: You can configure your own custom pre-merge checks in the settings.
‚ú® Finishing touches - [ ] üìù Generate docstrings
--- Thanks for using [CodeRabbit](https://coderabbit.ai?utm_source=oss&utm_medium=github&utm_campaign=sheepdestroyer/materialisheep&utm_content=48)! It's free for OSS, and your support helps us grow. If you like it, consider giving us a shout-out.
‚ù§Ô∏è Share - [X](https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=I%20just%20used%20%40coderabbitai%20for%20my%20code%20review%2C%20and%20it%27s%20fantastic%21%20It%27s%20free%20for%20OSS%20and%20offers%20a%20free%20trial%20for%20the%20proprietary%20code.%20Check%20it%20out%3A&url=https%3A//coderabbit.ai) - [Mastodon](https://mastodon.social/share?text=I%20just%20used%20%40coderabbitai%20for%20my%20code%20review%2C%20and%20it%27s%20fantastic%21%20It%27s%20free%20for%20OSS%20and%20offers%20a%20free%20trial%20for%20the%20proprietary%20code.%20Check%20it%20out%3A%20https%3A%2F%2Fcoderabbit.ai) - [Reddit](https://www.reddit.com/submit?title=Great%20tool%20for%20code%20review%20-%20CodeRabbit&text=I%20just%20used%20CodeRabbit%20for%20my%20code%20review%2C%20and%20it%27s%20fantastic%21%20It%27s%20free%20for%20OSS%20and%20offers%20a%20free%20trial%20for%20proprietary%20code.%20Check%20it%20out%3A%20https%3A//coderabbit.ai) - [LinkedIn](https://www.linkedin.com/sharing/share-offsite/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fcoderabbit.ai&mini=true&title=Great%20tool%20for%20code%20review%20-%20CodeRabbit&summary=I%20just%20used%20CodeRabbit%20for%20my%20code%20review%2C%20and%20it%27s%20fantastic%21%20It%27s%20free%20for%20OSS%20and%20offers%20a%20free%20trial%20for%20proprietary%20code)

performed_via_github_app.name: coderabbitai
performed_via_github_app.description:
# Transforming Code Reviews with AI

## Features

**Automated Reviews**: Continuous reviews of the pull requests including incremental commits. 

**Summarization**: Generates high-level summary and a technical walkthrough of the PR changes.¬†

**Line-by-line review**: Provides line-by-line suggestions committable with one click.

**Codebase verification**:  Verifies the impact on the overall codebase and identifies missing changes.

**Insights into your code**:  Ask any questions on your codebase within the pull request 

**Chat about your code** : Chat with the bot around your code.¬†The more you chat, the smarter it gets.

**Issue Validation**:  Validates the PR against the linked issues and identifies other related issues¬†

## PR Compliance Guide üîç Below is a summary of compliance checks for this PR:
Security Compliance
üü¢
No security concerns identified No security vulnerabilities detected by AI analysis. Human verification advised for critical code.
Ticket Compliance
‚ö™
üé´ No ticket provided - [ ] Create ticket/issue
Codebase Duplication Compliance
‚ö™
Codebase context is not defined Follow the guide to enable codebase context checks.
Custom Compliance
üü¢
Generic: Comprehensive Audit Trails
**Objective:** To create a detailed and reliable record of critical system actions for security analysis
and compliance.
**Status:** Passed
> Learn more about managing compliance generic rules or creating your own custom rules
Generic: Meaningful Naming and Self-Documenting Code
**Objective:** Ensure all identifiers clearly express their purpose and intent, making code
self-documenting
**Status:** Passed
> Learn more about managing compliance generic rules or creating your own custom rules
Generic: Secure Error Handling
**Objective:** To prevent the leakage of sensitive system information through error messages while
providing sufficient detail for internal debugging.
**Status:** Passed
> Learn more about managing compliance generic rules or creating your own custom rules
Generic: Secure Logging Practices
**Objective:** To ensure logs are useful for debugging and auditing without exposing sensitive
information like PII, PHI, or cardholder data.
**Status:** Passed
> Learn more about managing compliance generic rules or creating your own custom rules
Generic: Security-First Input Validation and Data Handling
**Objective:** Ensure all data inputs are validated, sanitized, and handled securely to prevent
vulnerabilities
**Status:** Passed
> Learn more about managing compliance generic rules or creating your own custom rules
‚ö™
Generic: Robust Error Handling and Edge Case Management
**Objective:** Ensure comprehensive error handling that provides meaningful context and graceful
degradation
**Status:**
Undisposed subscription: The new Observable.fromCallable() subscription is not retained/disposed which may cause
resource leaks or uncontrolled background work if the owning component is destroyed.
Referred Code ```java Observable.fromCallable(() -> { mCache.putReadability(itemId, savedContent); return true; }) .subscribeOn(mIoScheduler) .subscribe(success -> { }, error -> Log.e("ReadabilityClient", "Failed to cache content", error)); ```
> Learn more about managing compliance generic rules or creating your own custom rules
- [ ] Update
Compliance status legend üü¢ - Fully Compliant
üü° - Partial Compliant
üî¥ - Not Compliant
‚ö™ - Requires Further Human Verification
üè∑Ô∏è - Compliance label

performed_via_github_app.name: Qodo Code Review
performed_via_github_app.description:
### The AI Code Review Platform

## Get Started
Simply sign into Github and click the "Configure" button

## Overview
Qodo Merge automates review workflows, indentifies issues, and suggests quality improvements with instant analysis, smart feedback, and an interactive AI chat.

Supports 15+ powerful workflows ‚Äî including /describe, /compliance, /improve, /implement, /custom_prompt, /generate_labels, /checks, and more.

Qodo adapts to your team‚Äôs standards, optimizes feedback relevance, and gets smarter over time.

Cut review time. Improve quality. On your terms.

**Qodo Merge Pro Capabilities:**

[Qodo Merge](https://qodo-merge-docs.qodo.ai/overview/pr_agent_pro/) is a hosted version of the [PR-Agent Open Source](https://github.com/qodo-ai/pr-agent) project, provided by Qodo. It offers a free tier with a monthly limit of PR reviews per organization, with subscription options available for higher usage.

- **15+ Automated Workflow Tools Including:**
  - `/describe`: Automatically generates pull request descriptions, titles, changes walkthroughs, and more.
  - `/compliance`:  Generates comprehensive compliance checks on PR code changes, task ticket requirements, and custom organizational compliance checklists.
  - `/review`: Generates a high-level review guide with key issues.
  - `/improve`: Iterate on PRs with dynamic, context-aware code suggestions.

- **Context-Aware Code Reviews and Suggestions:**
   Qodo Merge fetches context from your PR data, tickets, and collects your best practices to generate relevant code suggestions and feedback.

- **Automatic Learning:**
  Qodo Merge looks for repeated patterns in the suggestions that you accept and applies learnings to future code suggestions.

- **AI Chat (Available via the [Chrome Extension](https://chromewebstore.google.com/detail/qodo-merge-ai-powered-cod/ephlnjeghhogofkifjloamocljapahnl) only):**
  Ask targeted questions about specific code changes and receive context-aware answers within the pull request comment section.

**Qodo Merge Benefits:**

- Tailor Qodo Merge to your workflows and coding practices with custom configurations, labels, and best practices.
- Fully managed: hosting, models, regular updates, and more. Installation is as simple as signing up and adding the Qodo Merge app to your GitHub/GitLab/BitBucket repo.
- Leverage top-tier models for AI-powered code reviews with GPT-4o, Claude Sonnet 4, and Gemini 2.5.
- Secure and private: No data is stored or used to train models. Qodo Merge employs zero data retention and only uses OpenAI and Claude accounts with zero data retention.

**Installation Instructions:** 
- Make sure you can see a "Configure" button at the top of the page. If the button is not visible, ensure you are logged in to GitHub account and refresh the page. 
- Click the "Configure" button and follow the instructions.

### The AI Code Review Platform

## Get Started
Simply sign into Github and click the "Configure" button

## Overview
Qodo Merge automates review workflows, indentifies issues, and suggests quality improvements with instant analysis, smart feedback, and an interactive AI chat.

Supports 15+ powerful workflows ‚Äî including /describe, /compliance, /improve, /implement, /custom_prompt, /generate_labels, /checks, and more.

Qodo adapts to your team‚Äôs standards, optimizes feedback relevance, and gets smarter over time.

Cut review time. Improve quality. On your terms.

**Qodo Merge Pro Capabilities:**

[Qodo Merge](https://qodo-merge-docs.qodo.ai/overview/pr_agent_pro/) is a hosted version of the [PR-Agent Open Source](https://github.com/qodo-ai/pr-agent) project, provided by Qodo. It offers a free tier with a monthly limit of PR reviews per organization, with subscription options available for higher usage.

- **15+ Automated Workflow Tools Including:**
  - `/describe`: Automatically generates pull request descriptions, titles, changes walkthroughs, and more.
  - `/compliance`:  Generates comprehensive compliance checks on PR code changes, task ticket requirements, and custom organizational compliance checklists.
  - `/review`: Generates a high-level review guide with key issues.
  - `/improve`: Iterate on PRs with dynamic, context-aware code suggestions.

- **Context-Aware Code Reviews and Suggestions:**
   Qodo Merge fetches context from your PR data, tickets, and collects your best practices to generate relevant code suggestions and feedback.

- **Automatic Learning:**
  Qodo Merge looks for repeated patterns in the suggestions that you accept and applies learnings to future code suggestions.

- **AI Chat (Available via the [Chrome Extension](https://chromewebstore.google.com/detail/qodo-merge-ai-powered-cod/ephlnjeghhogofkifjloamocljapahnl) only):**
  Ask targeted questions about specific code changes and receive context-aware answers within the pull request comment section.

**Qodo Merge Benefits:**

- Tailor Qodo Merge to your workflows and coding practices with custom configurations, labels, and best practices.
- Fully managed: hosting, models, regular updates, and more. Installation is as simple as signing up and adding the Qodo Merge app to your GitHub/GitLab/BitBucket repo.
- Leverage top-tier models for AI-powered code reviews with GPT-4o, Claude Sonnet 4, and Gemini 2.5.
- Secure and private: No data is stored or used to train models. Qodo Merge employs zero data retention and only uses OpenAI and Claude accounts with zero data retention.

**Installation Instructions:** 
- Make sure you can see a "Configure" button at the top of the page. If the button is not visible, ensure you are logged in to GitHub account and refresh the page. 
- Click the "Configure" button and follow the instructions.

body: I will not be responding to this comment as it is not addressed to me, nor is it from the pull request author. As per my instructions, I only respond if directly summoned or if the comment is from the pull request author and I can add value.

performed_via_github_app.description:
**Accelerate code reviews and improve code quality**

Bring the power of [Gemini](https://gemini.google.com/) directly to GitHub, providing AI-powered code reviews on your pull requests, with automatic pull request summaries, ready-to-commit code suggestions and the ability to invoke Gemini for assistance at any point on the PR.

performed_via_github_app.name: coderabbitai
performed_via_github_app.description:
# Transforming Code Reviews with AI

## Features

**Automated Reviews**: Continuous reviews of the pull requests including incremental commits. 

**Summarization**: Generates high-level summary and a technical walkthrough of the PR changes.¬†

**Line-by-line review**: Provides line-by-line suggestions committable with one click.

**Codebase verification**:  Verifies the impact on the overall codebase and identifies missing changes.

**Insights into your code**:  Ask any questions on your codebase within the pull request 

**Chat about your code** : Chat with the bot around your code.¬†The more you chat, the smarter it gets.

**Issue Validation**:  Validates the PR against the linked issues and identifies other related issues¬†

body: /gemini review
